abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Supporting Access to
            On-site Sanitation Services through Output-Based Aid Scheme
            Project for Senegal were as follows: outcome was moderately
            unsatisfactory, risk to development outcome was high, Bank
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: premature cessation of donor engagement
            can lead to a loss in momentum for major sector reform.
            Benefits of water investments may not be realized without
            adequate attention to sanitation. Raising tariffs only for
            one customer group may not be effective for ensuring long
            term sustainability. Determining the right threshold of the
            beneficiary contribution is vital for the successful
            delivery of peri-urban sanitation services. Complex
            management and institutional arrangements lead to
            implementation delays.
